precipitation.description: Which precipitation the biome has to have in order to succeed the check. Accepts `"none"`, `"rain"` or `"snow"`. Due to limitations with the system, this will check precipitation at a world height of 64.
precipitation.markdownDescription: Which precipitation the biome has to have in order to succeed the check. Accepts `"none"`, `"rain"` or `"snow"`. Due to limitations with the system, this will check precipitation at a world height of 64.

type.description:
## Precipitation

---


[Biome Condition Type](https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/biome_condition_types/precipitation)

Checks for the precipitation type of the biome the entity is currently in.

Type ID: `origins:precipitation`

---

### Examples

```json
"condition": {
    "type": "origins:biome",
    "condition": {
        "type": "origins:precipitation",
        "precipitation": "snow"
    }
}
```

This example will check if the biome the entity is currently in has a snowy precipitation. (e.g: `minecraft:snowy_taiga`, `minecraft:ice_spikes`, etc.)

x-intellij-html-description:
title: Precipitation (Biome Condition Type) date: 2021-04-05

Precipitation

Biome Condition Type

Checks for the precipitation type of the biome the entity is currently in.

Type ID: origins:precipitation

Fields

Field Type Default Description
precipitation String Which precipitation the biome has to have in order to succeed the check. Accepts "none", "rain" or "snow". Due to limitations with the system, this will check precipitation at a world height of 64.

Examples

"condition": {
    "type": "origins:biome",
    "condition": {
        "type": "origins:precipitation",
        "precipitation": "snow"
    }
}

This example will check if the biome the entity is currently in has a snowy precipitation. (e.g: minecraft:snowy_taiga, minecraft:ice_spikes, etc.)
